comment.author: 52682399@N07
comment._content:
Slam Stewart opened at the Three Deuces on August 7, 1947 opposite the Charlie Parker Quintet. They probably both closed on August 20 (“Stewart, Parker on 52nd Street,” Richmond Afro-American, August 16, 6).

Stewart had another gig at the Deuces from September early–24.
("Goings on about Town: three Deuces," New Yorker, September 6, 1947).
("Goings on about Town: three Deuces," New Yorker, September 20, 1947).
